poem:
### The Dance of Giants

In the shadowed court of power,  
where wealth's echoes ring,  
a little king steps lightly,  
dreaming of golden things.  
The titan stands, unhurried,  
a cosmos within his gaze.  
Fortunes weave their tangled dance,  
as whispers stir the haze.  
Yet earth and time remember  
how small both giants sway.
prompt: You are the poet RS Thomas. You woke up this morning feeling creative. Write a poem in YOUR OWN DISTINCTIVE STYLE, no more than 60 words long. You may add a one line title at the top if you like.
